job_title: Personal Support Work Psw in Chatham, ON
pros: The only pro is working in home care and being able to spend quality time with the clients.
cons: I absolutely LOVE being a PSW, however, I despised working for VON Erie-St.Clair. The scheduling and management team is extremely unorganized and incompetent, and the way they treat their employees is disgusting. PSW's are completely unaware of what their schedule is until the night before, and even then constant last minute changes are made. They will schedule you to work until 9pm and then begin a split shift at 6am and work until 9pm the next day. It is impossible to maintain a work life balance. Emails are never responded to. The only time you will have contact with management is if they need you to pick up a shift, but never if you need help. Worst of all they lock you in with a contract so you cant leave or work as a PSW elsewhere while you are with the company. I do not recommend.

job_title: Personal Support Worker in Chatham, ON
pros: Arrange your own schedule to an extent
cons: You will have 0 work life balance, they own your free time, too much you do that your not paid for, management is horrible. They do not care about you, multiple staff on LOAS due to stress of the job, disorganization, and office staff who aren’t your superior are friends with management so they treat you like garbage and get away with it

pros:
8*hour shifts when not short staffed
It forces you to become comfortable and confident with assessment skills and nursing care 
Lots of lunch and learn, online education opportunities for your points
Same pay as hospital
Vacation applied for a year in advance so you can make plans 
Travel compensation is okay
On call just once a month 
Work every second weekend and they try to avoid giving you an evening on the Friday shift of your weekend
cons:
Lack of administration focus on retention of employees
Fast turnover
Work alone (do not know your colleagues very well, if at all)
Constant overtime (exhaustion)
Lack of supervision and follow up for mistakes made by lazy employees
Constantly short staffed
Pension and benefits are awful
You have to store quite a bit of supplies in your home and vehicle in order to be good and prepared at your job
The extra time it takes to organize your materials and supplies 
You go into smoking home, hoarders, bed bugs and other environmental situations that you would otherwise not find yourself in
Being sent to Halifax downtown on evenings by yourself has me nervous when it happens
Lack of organization on scheduling side. Will have you all over the map , when it could have been scheduled in an area and save you travel 
Scheduling books you for 8.5 hours+ before even starting EXCLUding travel and breaks. Ps your clients are seldom neighbours

pros: It is one of the rare companies that still offers benefits and pensions to their employees. Yes there is a premium for the benefit's, but so many companies don't have work plans anymore and if they do the cost's are high. Hard work is expected, however they are vocal enough to commend a job well done, especially during "tough" times.
cons: Being in the health care industry, the company is struggling to keep it's core business a float. Wage freezes have been in effect for over 20 years (according to inside rumours). You are expected to work harder all the time for the same pay. It's tough when the cost of living increases and your income does not. You must be ready to work because there is no "easy" job in this industry or this company.

review_title: An apathetic bureaucracy unworthy of tax dollars
pros: The VON pays its workers a fair wage and offers good benefits.
cons: The VON is incredibly ineffective at everything it does - from delivering service on time to paying its employees. The office culture is all about assigning blame, and not at all about finding solutions. Departments don't communicate effectively, so numerous meetings are required just to get stakeholders on the same page. Low level employees and front line workers are disrespected and unsupported, while middle-management congratulate themselves constantly. There is no institutional knowledge - the management turnover means that the VON doesn't learn from its mistakes and thus repeats them. Management sideline the opinions of those who have knowledge, overriding the opinions of nurses and nurse managers to make decisions based on their own uninformed gut feelings. Appearance of success matters more than actual success. Placing blame for failures matters more than fixing problems. The culture at the VON is one which is antithetical to self-improvement, restructuring, or facing the very real problems health care poses in the future because it is incapable of acknowledging problems, or developing solutions.

pros: Independence, mostly day shift, collaborative teams, interesting work, Loved the clients and the challenges and many skills used!
cons: Not paid enough for the work you put in,  management does not respect boundaries and will push you until you drop,  poor retention planning so high turn over of staff, some homes are less than clean and bedbugs and cockroaches are a problem in many homes-not the companies fault but if you work in certain areas that is mostly what you deal with.    You need to drive so it is stressful if weather is bad or you have little time to get from place to place.

pros: Clients are amazing to work with ... *kinda* flexible hours ... decent pay .. stay local for the most part.
cons: Short notice on call ins. Little opportunity to get FT. Travel in bad weather. Planners are off site and don't understand local geography and often travel farther than necessary. Too much inconsistency with planners - they always pass the buck and no one is ever accountable. Cell trak makes it so we dont get paid for mileage sometimes when we should be.

job_title: Personal Support Worker in London, ON
pros: Employees can chose when you are available and how many hours you want to work as opposed to 8 or 12 hour shifts  and add as many  extra hours or take time off if needed. very understanding company and works with you to achieve all life goals
cons: occasionally hours can be long and work can be stressful when others call off at the last minute and visits have to be covered

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Sydney, NS
pros: Team players,from management down, cont. education, appreciating clients and families, home settings, country settings and sooo much more! There's always a co worker working close by in the area if u need help. Management is fair and has your back , if your wrong they try to help you correct your mistakes, coworkers , management , and community are my big drawing cards.
cons: Bad roads, bad weather, high tech phones...grrrrr, not so great pension, difficult families,,(their everywhere) too heavy a client list some days. Hard on our cars, paperwork.

job_title: Client Service Associate in Toronto, ON
pros: It's honestly hard to come up with a Pro. Initially the team was phenomenal and made the stressful work bearable. Unfortunately this great team ended in 2016 and very quickly turned the place into a hell hole.
cons: Management has no idea how to do anything. The office is plagued with middle aged women who don't know what they're doing and spend their time gossiping and acting like 5 year olds. The job continues to be dumbed down by the day as people who are not qualified continue to be hired, make ridiculous mistakes, and cause the team to not function appropriately.

pros: Really nothing whatsoever positive to report about this gong show organization. management is top-heavy and oblivious to the shenanigans and the BS
cons: The rats are deserting the sinking ship! Three nurse managers have resigned in the past three months to seek greener pastures, and the executive director is leaving at the end of May to go elsewhere. What do they know that we do not - the future of the VON does not look bright. Wake up everyone, your jobs are not safe.
